text: Anwar al-Awlaki (also spelled al-Aulaqi, al-Awlaqi; Anwar al-‘Awlaqī; April 21/22, 1971 – September 30, 2011) was a Yemeni-American imam. He was a known recruiter and motivational speaker representing al-Qaeda.How Anwar Al-Awlaki Inspired Terror From Across the Globe retrieved February 4, 2012 Al-Awlaki became the first U.S. citizen to be targeted and killed by a U.S. drone strike without the rights of due process.Gal Perl Finkel, A NEW STRATEGY AGAINST ISIS, The Jerusalem Post, March 7, 2017. He was known as the "bin Laden of the Internet" for positing pro al-Qaeda speeches on the internet. After a request from the U.S. Congress, in November 2010, Google removed many of al-Awlaki's videos from its websites. According to The New York Times, al-Awlaki's public statements and videos have been more influential in inspiring acts of terrorism after his killing than before his death. ==References== Category:1971 births Category:2011 deaths Category:Deaths by airstrike Category:Yemeni people Category:Al-Qaeda people Category:American terrorists Category:People from Las Cruces, New Mexico
